page.title: 17PUBLIC SERVICES IN NEWRY.
page.content: There are 21 men and 3 officers in Newry fire-station.They practise two hours every Thursday night.They put out 12,00 fires a year.In hot weather they put out 30 daily but in normal weather 3 or 4.It took 5 days to extinguist Sands Mill, a place in Newry which sells animal food.They used 1000gals of water to put the fire out.The fire-station was built in 1958 and opened in 1960.It is in Cecil St., a central position in the town.It takes 1gal of water to put out a chimney fire and 3gals to put out a livingroom fire.For leisure the firemen play snooker,darts and cards. You have to be over 18 and under 35 before you can join the fire brigade.
